abstract: Op-Ed article by former Defense Sec David Perry argues United States can safely phase out its intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM) force, key part of Cold War nuclear strategy, without compromising security; contends that ICBMs are outdated and funds would be better spent elsewhere in military; urges America to build only nuclear arsenal levels needed for deterrence, and asserts only way to avoid nuclear arms race with Russia is not to participate.

lead_paragraph: These missiles are expensive and dangerous holdovers from a long-gone era. It’s time to phase them out.
